conclusion: Cars A and B are traveling in the same direction on a straight road.
Their v-t graphs are shown in the figure.
It is known that the two cars are side by side at t=30s.
The task is to determine the maximum distance between Car A and Car B between the two instances when they are side by side.
The v-t graph shows two lines, A and B, intersecting at t=20s and t=30s.
Line A is horizontal at 40 m/s from t=0 to t=30s.
Line B starts at 0 m/s, increases linearly to 40 m/s at t=20s, and remains at 40 m/s from t=20s to t=30s.
The two lines intersect at t=20s and t=30s.
The area under the line represents the displacement.
The area under line A from t=0 to t=30s is 1200 m.
The area under line B from t=0 to t=20s is 400 m.
The area under line B from t=20 to t=30s is 400 m.
The total area under line B from t=0 to t=30s is 800 m.
At t=20s, the two cars are side by side.
From t=10s to t=20s, the displacement of Car A is 400 m.
From t=10s to t=20s, the displacement of Car B is 300 m.
